headline.main: Teaser: “Breakfast in Bed” by Kenneth Tam

docs.snippet: For the "Made in L.A." art show at the Hammer Museum, Tam solicited men from social networking online forums to bring them together for a workshop of sorts in male bonding....
docs.lead_paragraph: For the "Made in L.A." art show at the Hammer Museum, Tam solicited men from social networking online forums to bring them together for a workshop of sorts in male bonding.

headline.main: Detroit Eyes Refunding of Up to $660 Million Bonds
headline.print_headline: Detroit Eyes Refunding of Up to $660 Million Bonds

docs.snippet: Detroit would sell its first general obligation bonds since exiting bankruptcy in December 2014 under a proposal by Mayor Mike Duggan's administration to refund up to $660 million of outstanding bonds....
docs.lead_paragraph: Detroit would sell its first general obligation bonds since exiting bankruptcy in December 2014 under a proposal by Mayor Mike Duggan's administration to refund up to $660 million of outstanding bonds.

headline.main: Analysis-Czechs Must Take Euro Inspiration From Past Glories
headline.print_headline: Analysis-Czechs Must Take Euro Inspiration From Past Glories

docs.snippet: Whether it was Antonin Panenka's insouciant penalty or Karel Poborsky's audacious chip, the great Czech sides of the past had a sense of adventure and daring that the current team seems to lack, judging by Monday's 1-0 defeat to Spain....
docs.lead_paragraph: Whether it was Antonin Panenka's insouciant penalty or Karel Poborsky's audacious chip, the great Czech sides of the past had a sense of adventure and daring that the current team seems to lack, judging by Monday's 1-0 defeat to Spain.

headline.main: Tight Security Planned for Charleston Shooting Anniversary Events
headline.print_headline: Tight Security Planned for Charleston Shooting Anniversary Events

docs.snippet: Security will be high at events in Charleston commemorating a mass shooting at an African-American church in which nine people died a year ago this week, police said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Security will be high at events in Charleston commemorating a mass shooting at an African-American church in which nine people died a year ago this week, police said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Surprising Progress in Newtown Families’ Suit Against Maker of the AR-15 Rifle
headline.print_headline: Newtown Families Take Novel Approach in Suit Against AR-15 Rifle Maker

docs.snippet: A lawsuit brought by relatives of the shooting victims in Connecticut argues that the AR-15 is a weapon of war and should never have been marketed to civilians....
docs.abstract: Families of victims of Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings in Newtown, Conn, have mounted legal challenge against Remington, manufacturer of AR-15 rifle used in massacre, with surprising success so far; legal case, which argues weapon is meant for war and should not have been marketed to civilians, could get assist due to timing of attack on Orlando, Fla, nightclub, in which perpetrator used similar weapon.

byline.original: By KRISTIN HUSSEY and LISA W. FODERARO

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit brought by relatives of the shooting victims in Connecticut argues that the AR-15 is a weapon of war and should never have been marketed to civilians.

headline.main: Brazil Congressional Committee Vote Deals Blow to Ex-Speaker Eduardo Cunha

headline.main: McIlroy Focusing on Disciplined Approach as Oakmont Looms
headline.print_headline: McIlroy Focusing on Disciplined Approach as Oakmont Looms

docs.snippet: Rory McIlroy winced ever so slightly as he uttered the words, well aware of their connotations even though he intended no disrespect to some of the greatest moments of his career....
